New Records: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 33 points and added seven assists in the Thunder's win.
Aaron Wiggins made five 3-pointers in the fourth quarter.
Oklahoma City extended their winning streak to 14 games.
The Thunder overcame a 14-point deficit to secure the victory.
Key Match Events: The Thunder led a comeback from a 14-point deficit.
Oklahoma City ended the Knicks' nine-game winning streak.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder led the Knicks 44-5 in points off the bench.
Isaiah Hartenstein faced his former team for the first time since leaving in free agency.
Others: The Thunder's loss in the NBA Cup final in December is not counted as an official loss.
